page.title: 17RELIGION IN TIDWORTH
page.content: The majority of people in the area are Church of England (CofE),but only a small percentage attend church regu- larly. The remainder are a mixture of various denominations including Roman Catholics (RC) most of whom practise their faith. There are four churches in Tidworth, St. Michael's Garrison Church (CofE), St. Patrick's and St. George's Garrison Church (RC), St. Andrew's and St. Mark's Garrison Church (Church of Scotland,Methodist and Free Churches) and Holy Trinity (CofE). There is also St. Mary's,South Tidworth,built in l879,which although consecrated is only used for special occasions and is maintained by the Redundant Churches Fund. A Mortuary Chapel,built l870,although still con- secrated is not now used,the adjoining graveyard is still used. There are no Oriental or Jewish places of worship.
